reasoning: Miscarriage rate among women of reproductive age: approximately 15% of pregnancies (~140 million annual pregnancies globally) result in miscarriage, yielding ~21 million cases/year. Calculated as rate per 100k women of reproductive age. Moderate confidence: strong epidemiological data on miscarriage rates, but metric (person-years) does not align perfectly with pregnancy outcome measurement.
source: ACOG Clinical Practice Guidelines and WHO estimates on miscarriage epidemiology
